Given an even integer $n$ (2 ≤ $n$ ≤ 1000), find a square matrix of size $n \times n$ that satisfies the following conditions:

* All elements in the main diagonal are 0.
* The matrix is symmetric (meaning it is the same when read top-to-bottom as it is when read bottom-to-top).
* All numbers in each row are distinct and range from 0 to $n-1$.

Output the matrix. If there are multiple solutions, output any one.
Create a square matrix of a given even size.  The matrix must be symmetrical, have 0s along the main diagonal, and each row must contain unique numbers from 0 to the matrix size - 1.
